website_summaries.verdict: If you need a reliable label maker that ensures a fast and simple label-making process, this is the best bang for your buck.
pros: A top choice for its speedy access to a wealth of symbols, fonts, and frames, with hundreds of items to choose from
cons: A common complaint is that this label maker tends to waste tape when making labels - a potentially pricey downfall

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker. I love it for labeling my essential oil bottles.
customer_reviews.text: I love my new label maker. This is my first one and it works great. It came with a 24 mm tape and I used all of it in one night labeling my homemade essential oil blends. I reordered more tapes. The keyboard is large and easy to type. It has label and print display. I saved my labels in a file for easy retrieval later on. I'm very happy to own this product. The 24 mm tape has up to 7 lines of text. The 18 mm tape has up to 5 lines of text. I love the font, symbol, and frame settings. It has a minimum of 6 point font size to 48 point. See attached photos.
customer_reviews.author: ExoticAromas

customer_reviews.title: Moiré patterns on display make it unusable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second PD600 I've tried. I returned the first one immediately and I'll return the second one. Both have colored banding on the display that moves as you move your viewing angle. The image shows an example -- but when viewed with the naked eye the colored banding (known technically as moiré patterns) is vertical. The iPhone see those as diagonal bands. Either way, the ever-shifting colored bands are nausea inducing. Either I have a two bad units (which I doubt) or Brother has a serious technical problem with the colored displays. I've been a loyal Brother P-Touch fan since the first units were introduced, so I'm sad to see what appears to be a mistake like this.
customer_reviews.author: AndyJL

customer_reviews.title: Great PC compatible device...needs to offer Linux support!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Brother PTD600 PC Connectible Label maker for being able to import graphics into the labels. I was most impressed with a friend's Brother label printer (that did not import external graphics) and decided to "go big". Being able to import personal (created ) graphics makes it worth the extra cost. Just my humble opinion. The Brother software works flawlessly (so far) on my 64bit Windows 7 computer. * As primarily a Linux user I (and other Linux users) can only wish for full Linux support for such great devices!!! Brother, are you listening? Please!
customer_reviews.author: MGBguy

customer_reviews.title: Totally Useless For Macintosh Users
customer_reviews.text: Unless you happen to be on OS8 or OS9. Duh! Decades old software? You've got to be kidding! There is a Brother PT-D600.app, but it's useless, too. They're pretty up to date for PCs and have lots of PC additions for design add-ons. It seems the person at Brother in charge of this product line doesn't give a S#it. Great Label maker, but without any Mac software, is limited to what you can do. Totally and completely disappointed with Brother.
customer_reviews.author: D.A.Wagner

customer_reviews.title: My eyes!!!! I can't see after looking at the Rainbow!
customer_reviews.text: I think I received a defective machine. The screen has a rainbow on it. And it hurts my eyes just to look at it while trying to make labels. Please contact me to exchange the machine ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Basia

customer_reviews.title: So I got this, to label around the house ...
customer_reviews.text: So I got this, to label around the house and at work. To my dismay it seems that the one I received has a feed issue, as it jams every single time I use it. It appears as though the feed portion of the device is not aligned properly, so it pushes the paper back behind the cartridge and jams up, will contact company and change review based on how that conversation goes
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just as expected. Initially had problems using the software I downloaded from Brother. Called them for better clarification and they were able to help.Also purchased extra tapes from Amazon who had the best price - very reasonable. I am happy and pleased so far with this product. If you need to label your personal home or work equipment this is the way to go. The only con is to get used to using the software so that your description fits on the label when it prints. This gets a little getting used to, but once you get past this it will become a valuable tool for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great Potential Purposely Unrealized
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice machine to have; but, it has one horribly annoying, built-in, money-making, customer hating feature that can not be overlooked: It cuts off just over an inch of tape before each label created. So, if the average label is two inches long, then it wastes ~33% of the tape; and, the tape isn't cheap. If the user is resourceful, he can use all those one inch pieces of discarded tape for other things; but, that doesn't diminish the fact that Brother is purposefully punishing the customer for Brother's own greedy profit. Side-note: Without this label maker working with a computer, some of the features aren't usable.
customer_reviews.author: David Eason

customer_reviews.title: Good But..
customer_reviews.text: First shipment product was defective (USB) didn't work. 2nd shipment USB worked. In both cases the Color screen had parallel lines _transparent going across the screen. It was annoying but usable. Software for label making was pretty good. It comes with a .94" cartridge. If you are using the older .47" tapes, you just adjust the cartridge size in the Print Properties. Plus I spent some time with "support" trying to get the initial shipment to work. I was under impressed. Amazon sent out the replacement product immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: Used item
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t look new to me. The picture you see is straight out of the box. Super annoying as I don’t have that time to return stuff! Really needed this item and looked forward to receiving it. I am so disappointed right now.
customer_reviews.author: Rendaa

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a labeler that could accomadate different size widths of tape. This one will go as wide as 1 inch. I also bought the "generic" label tape on Amazon that works perfectly with this.
customer_reviews.author: SC-CT

customer_reviews.title: A step backward from my previous Brother P-Touch Labeler, more complicated setup, & a cartridge style change
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Brother P-Touch Label Maker, and it works in a similar fashion, though it is somewhat more complicated. I can deal with that, but the fact that they changed their cartridge slightly means that I have 5 tape cartridges that I cannot use in this machine. That is an expensive annoyance that really ticks me off! I suppose I t will get the job done, but had I known about the change in cartridges, I would not have purchased this model, and I probably wouldn’t have purchased a Brother at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lacemaker427

customer_reviews.title: Uses too much tape and poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: I was initially excited but...I should have believed the poor reviews. 1. A blank tape prints before the real label prints. This results in wasting too much of the tape. Given that the tape itself is expensive this is really wasteful. 2. The self service online help is not very helpful in addressing any questions. Contacting support is not exactly intuitive. Once you find the link to send them a question in an email, you wait approximately 24 hours for a response. There used to be a chat feature. That disappeared. 3. If you have issues updating the firmware on the actual machine. Forget it. I eventually figured it out but it took a bit of patience.
customer_reviews.author: Miss G

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible with TZ Tapes!
customer_reviews.text: I researched this and purchased this unit PRECISELY because I had an older P-touch with several tapes (which cost more than the unit itself), since it supposedly could use them. The Brother website claims that the TZe tapes are identical to the TZ tapes except that they are more environmentally friendly, and that both will work. That is not true. In this P-Touch, there is an additional post for a hole that is not present in the TZ tapes. So, my TZ tapes are useless here. If I knew that going in, I could have made an informed choice. But Brother is totally publishing false compatibility information regarding their new versus old tape formats.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Komuves

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is really overkill for the simple use for which I bought it. All I am likely to ever use it for is to make labels for the plant markers I use in my daylily garden. I have quite a few different cultivars, and I need to keep track of their names, so I use weather resistant Brother labels printed with this device. I connect it to my computer, having designed a proper label, and type the names and other information for printing. The label design is stored by the computer to be used whenever I need to make more labels.
customer_reviews.author: AlaProf

customer_reviews.title: Whoa... the colors!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of promise out of the (somewhat damaged) box. Ready to put a few labels on things. And then, I turned it on. Whoa. The moire rainbow patterns mentioned by others are in full display. I can’t look at it without getting vertigo. Brother, time to buy screens from a different supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good label printer but wastes a lot of tape
customer_reviews.text: As a label printer goes, this model works very well. My complaint is how much tape it wastes... everything it prints always has about an inch of blank tape before and after the text. I wind up using scissors to cut off all the wasted tape on every label it prints. I guess Brother wants to sell as much label tape as they can so they design their printers to waste as much as possible....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great before the display burned out . Very unhappy item is useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Mb

customer_reviews.title: Machine works fine.  Cannot use stock of TZ tape.  Uses TZe Only!
customer_reviews.text: Label machine works great and easy to connect to computer. Bought this only because our old P-Touch cannot be used with newer computers. To my disgust I found our total stockpile of TZ tapes cannot be used because the machine only uses the newer TZe tape. So I had to immediately spend more on new tape than the machine costs. Strangely new TZe tape can be used in old machine but not old tape in new machine. Yes they do mention this as an aside in touting the environmentally friendly new packaging of the TZe tapes but it needs to be made more obvious.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: You can get up and running without reading the instructions that is a real time-saver
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I like about this machine is that you can use it completely without a computer. You can also use it without reading the instructions so you can get up and running in no time at all. You can bring it anywhere and make labels on the go. The built-in cutter is a great feature but you just didn't have to plan for it in your layout before you print. Also nice that you can save files in the machine for future use. Finally the great advantage of courses you can print on 1inch wide labels.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas O' Grady

customer_reviews.title: You'll only like it if you haven't used a PT-1810
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to replace my old Brother PT-1810 label maker so I figured I'd upgrade. What a mistake. A rediculous number of options you'll never use so you have to go through 4 or 5 steps to do what you used to be able to do in one or two. Their new less expensive label maker is no better and the fonts don't match my old label maker. The worst thing is that it doesn't remember settings and defaults every time you use it so you have to set things up over and over and over again. PLEASE BRING BACK THE 1810!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Sterling

customer_reviews.title: A Great Machine for Making Labels
customer_reviews.text: The machine is easy to use, the display is easy to read, and the labels are printed perfectly. On battery, one can print about 3.5 cartridges of labels. For mobile printing, this is great. Alternatively one can use wall power and print all day. The printer uses different sices of labels, and fits my needs well. I have not tried editing with their print drivers yet. For my purposes, the keyboard is flexible enough and easy to use. A very standard querty layout. I would recommend this without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: G. P. Neer

customer_reviews.title: This is my 3rd brother 3rd printer and I am disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Being the third printer in 7 years I has expected this unit to be at least as good as the last two. It is not!!!! I don't expect this printer to last 6 months. The plastic case looks and feels fragile. The motor whines as if it is in pain. It prints correctly. I use a PC to make the labels and an AC charger which has worked well in the past. This printer is disappointing use caution when considering the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom In Rome Ga

customer_reviews.title: Wasteful with the labels
customer_reviews.text: I've barely even tapped into the available features, but it's been a great little printer so far. My only gripe is the amount of label material it wastes - why feed an inch of new label, just to cut it of BEFORE printing?! When printing small labels, it wastes more than it uses - which can get spendy.
customer_reviews.author: OBSSD

customer_reviews.title: Bad rainbow screen? Remove the plastic film (there's 2 on the screen)
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had a broken screen initially because it was very hard to read and looked rainbow-y. It turns out there was just another thin plastic film on top of the screen that I missed. So there's 3 plastic films, 1 big one covering the screen area, 1 smaller one covering just the screen itself, and 1 covering the tape area. Anyway, I haven't tried everything yet, but it's been working great so far.
customer_reviews.author: torx

customer_reviews.title: Clunky to use. Interface(screen) to small. Too much trail and error
customer_reviews.text: Took me month or more to finally get the PC to work w/label maker. Printer driver conflicts with HP printer. Using it by itself, the screen is not enough characters showing at one time to make using the maker efficient. So many underlying commands to have to remember if you don't use it that much. Have to go back to the manuel too much. Now, the program from the PC is much better but if your going to use the PC mostly, that interface could be much easier. "Brother's if your listening, make the interfaces usable by a child", with little pictures, pop-up balloons, and maybe a super-mini video.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING LABEL MAKER! I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Where I work, we use a brother label printer, so I was researching Amazon to see if I could find one that did cool stuff like this and was at a decent price point. I came across this, read the reviews, decided to buy it, and I regret nothing, it’s actually an awesome little label printer! Made label for practically everything I own lol 😂
customer_reviews.author: FYI

customer_reviews.title: .25'' to 1.'' tapes available, large print to .5'' on 1.'' wide tape. Many block options
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to replace my older DYNO D1 label maker due to small print size for tool cabinet doors, very handy to have for ID on a engine wire harness when pulling the engine. I also like the available width sized tapes and plenty of text and line block opptions. It's too big for use as a ad held unit, although it's larger size makes for quick use on a counter or desk top.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt B

customer_reviews.title: This one
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I printed professional clear/black decals for the handles on my toolbox. Two decades and I finally am able to open the right drawer the first time. The white/black tape is great for black or white surfaces as one can invert the print colors to suit either for a seamless blend.
customer_reviews.author: tahotoy

customer_reviews.title: Great Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great label printer just do yourself a favor and don't buy Brother brand labels. There are highly rated, quality generic labels available on Amazon and you can save money buy getting those. Still, the printer itself is great. The screen is bright and clear, I love that it cuts the labels itself, there are a great selection of fonts and styles and it seems (so far) to be pretty easy on batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C Drywater

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker with tons of options!
customer_reviews.text: I love the display feature so I can see my project before I print it. No wasted labels that turn out wrong. I also love that it will store like 100 labels, so if needed I can just choose one design and with this Brother P Touch change the wording. The cartridges are easy to load and I've had no problems that have required any tech support. I've purchased this again for a friend!! Would highly recommend this label maker!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy J.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Don't have any problems with my PTD600 so far. Battery is NOT included. I just took a picture so you may see it runs on 6 AA batteries. USB cable, adapter, and one 24mm tape is included.
customer_reviews.author: Jaylene

customer_reviews.title: Very good labeler
customer_reviews.text: I love this and use it all of the time. First, the batteries last well. That is huge, because you want it to work when you get it out. It prints well, and has tons of options. It does waste some tape. That isn’t a big deal. You have lots of options for affordable tape. Also, you can set it to auto trim the tape, so you don’t have to manually cut it with scissors. Thus machine is pretty big, but still every portable. Also, it isn’t as tech oriented as my old Dymo Rhino. Otherwise, it is perfect
customer_reviews.author: WWH

customer_reviews.title: Durable, great for organizing, so many options!
customer_reviews.text: We use this same label maker at work and let me tell you we put it through a lot in the Department of the Navy. Since I wanted to get my storage bins organized with labels I knew this was my only choice. This label maker works great! It has a lot of different fonts and options. It is very heavy duty and can withstand many drops and things being smashed into it. You can buy so many different label tape colors and sizes. With the pre-made designs it makes signage really easy. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a label maker!
customer_reviews.author: PersistantWelderChic

customer_reviews.title: TOP SHELF LABEL MAKER!! ❤️
customer_reviews.text: This is the best on the market for non-commercial use, in my opinion. We had one of these in a lab where I used to work, and I fell in love with it. Now my whole house is at risk of being labeled!! ❤️
customer_reviews.author: E. J.

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to PC
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the software to install properly. I love the brother label printers. However, I bought this model specifically so I could use the computer to generate labels. The software installs but will not find the attached label printer even though I can clearly see it in device manager (Windows 10, Surface Book).
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Advena

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong with this Brother
customer_reviews.text: Love having a Brother one inch label maker. I'm using mine in reorganizing my wood shop. I have many many parts, nails, screws, washers of all sizes,etc and etc. This will also come in handy to label my vast collection of router bits, approximately 150 of them. Very happy with the quality and labels that it can produce. Very easy machine to use.
customer_reviews.author: Emory C. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love that it hooks to my Mac and I can create fonts, styles, & graphics that suit me. And I can save them to my hard disc to use again. Never have tried onboard controls so I can’t speak to that. Couple of glitches with connection software and it frequent crashes. Overall I would not look for anything else. (Please fix software!)
customer_reviews.author: Firelance8015

customer_reviews.title: screen did not work
customer_reviews.text: the labeler was brand new and the color screen did not work. there were diagonal colored lines in the background. this is not what i would expect from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use your PC with this tool for Great Results!
customer_reviews.text: The interface of the built-in commands is confusing. A video on their web page is sorely needed. All I could find on the Brother P-Touch website was a promo/commercial. HOWEVER...when I used my computer, and the downloaded software, things got way better. Tapes are pricier than we would like, but the finished product cannot be beaten. Great labels and signs. Lots of options, fonts, and clever clipart and symbols. Very happy with the tool. -GUYr8s
customer_reviews.author: Guyr8s

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get this label printer connected to my PC very quickly and easily. I love that it has a power adapter so I don't have to waste batteries. I love that I can print single labels or multiple labels in one shot. I love that I can print from my PC or using only the printer. The keyboard is large enough that I can easily press a single key yet small enough to be easily portable. The display is easy to read and I was able to print a label from the printer directly without ever having to read the directions. Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Carson

customer_reviews.title: Stupid keyboard layout - long learning curve
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to make a lot of DIFFERENT style labels and want them just right - I'd allow three or four hours of training time as you read the manual and play around with the machine. Much of what this thing can do is NOT INTUITIVE! FYI: It wastes expensive tape but fortunately the aftermarket tapes are much cheaper and work perfectly
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Machine
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used it connected via USB to a PC. It's straight forward and easy to use, prints nice and clear, etc. The negative is that it wastes tape. I had seen this on other reviews and hoped this just occurred each time you turned the unit on. However, it occurs every time you print something out; approximately an inch of tape is cut off and discarded prior to your printed portion.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Love this label maker!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old label maker I had with this one and am so glad I did! I love how easy it is to use and find myself looking for things to label! I do wish there were a few more options available on the label maker itself for positioning words on the label (top, middle, bottom, left, right or center), but I can access those options when I plug it in to my computer so it isn't the end of the world.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Haven't even checked the manual yet. I noticed some people on here complaining about the rainbow band "moire" effect on the display. This is caused by the protective plastic film that is applied to the screen to protect it from getting scratched during shipment. After it's removed the problem is gone. No need to return or replace. To reduce paper waste, there is a setting to set the margin to narrow. Still wastes some tape, but not as bad. I got this model since it supports more sizes, up to 1" or 0.97".
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simple label maker. Bought this unit after comparing less expensive units. Primarily chose this one because it included the power adapter (versus sold separately). It's easy to use, a variety of cartridges/tape styles are available, and has been able to create everything I've wanted (beyond my initial intentions). My only disappointment is that defaults to LARGE MARGIN, causing it to use much more tape than necessary. However, I can easily change the margins to my preferred NO CUT, which minimizes wasting tape. I have not yet utilized the USB computer connection.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: This will not use TZ tapes, only the new TZe tapes, a complete ripoff by this company.
customer_reviews.text: My old printer burned out, and I thought I was getting one that was compatible with my tape inventory, but I never noticed that tiny little "e". I'm not happy. This should have been pointed out. I guarantee I'm not the first to be burned by this. These tapes are ridiculously expensive, I live abroad, and cannot easily obtain them; they are outrageously priced.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Garber

customer_reviews.title: Super useful for custom blends
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that logos don’t look good on the labels and I had to make them black and white to look remotely acceptable. Otherwise I can’t live without this label maker. I use it with PC which is so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Functional & versatile
customer_reviews.text: Originally I wanted a labeler for my plants and seed plantings. This unit works great for labeling those & for leftovers in the freezer & most anything that I used to use a Sharpie for. I like that I can use it standalone as well as connected to my computer. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stekli

customer_reviews.title: Really nice label maker (kind of bulky)
customer_reviews.text: My previous Brother P-Touch label maker died - I'd had it for many years. I found this one and I think it will meet all of my printing needs. Lots more fonts, symbols, etc. over my previous model. The auto-cutting is nice. Easy to use. Being PC is a really nice bonus. My only real complaint is that it is kind of bulky but I'd say it's otherwise perfect. Keep on eye on the price, it seems to wildly fluctuate.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Dorff

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. The print fonts are average. It’s not too user friendly. I would suggest another brand hoping it’s better than this one. I wish it was rechargeable instead of battery operated. I don’t use it often so the batteries go dead.
customer_reviews.author: bobmac

customer_reviews.title: Love this label maker
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model that only does up to 3/4" and I needed 1", so I bought this one. I haven't quite figured out how to use the software to transfer labels from my computer but the labels I've made on the device come out perfect for my essential oil bottles. Also, this model doesn't seem to waste as much tape as my older one, which I am thrilled with.
customer_reviews.author: Donni

customer_reviews.title: Was hoping it could do more.
customer_reviews.text: I’m regretting this purchase. Mostly because I thought I could make really cool labels. I honestly should’ve just purchased a lower priced model. I have a MacBook, and Brother doesn’t really have the software available to make the awesome labels that you could possibly make with a Windows pc. It’s really just an expensive, glorified label maker. The only thing I appreciate is getting the a/c adapter in the box. I’m still debating on whether I should return it and get a cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: Karen C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect label printer!
customer_reviews.text: It you don't mind the relatively large size, this is the perfect label printer. The keyboard is large, and the features easy to figure out and use. Changing tapes is a snap. Labels look great and it's easy to get the protective paper of the backs. Nice!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fredericksen

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular!
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier. Prints on large labels (about 1"), text is nice and crisp without being blocky. Lots of font choices, templates, customizability. I've been using it a few times a month for the last year and it's still going on the original set of batteries. Only complaint is that (like all label makers) it always has to spit out a little extra clipping before it can print a label, which ends up wasting a lot of tape over time. Never found a label maker that is 100% efficient with tape, so I'm willing to accept this as its only flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Max Batchelder

customer_reviews.title: Can make up to 99 copies at once and it cuts each one,  really what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Just ditched my Edson label printer for this. I can print up to 99 copies at one time compared to only 9 max with the ebson. This also cuts each label for me. I save much time and frustration. Only negative is that my screen has a weird rainbow effect. Like rainbow lines, don’t know if that’s supposed to be like that or not. Looks similar to when you take a photo of a computer screen. I don’t much like that but it’s ok I’ll deal w it I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Resolution is very good. The PC software makes this the perfect label maker for complex labels, if you just need a single line of text on a label you can get a cheaper model. Great selection of label colors as well. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: WingNut

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but wastes paper
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing and use it to put price markings on my photography at art fairs and galleries. My only complaint is that there is a lot of extra paper being wasted. I adjusted the margins and read the manual and still can't figure out how to eliminate the paper waste.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey Hart

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it, but only one draw back. It wastes label tape when it prints. I think they need to redesign that part. Label tape isn't cheap! Otherwise It's been used for so many things in my! I'm addicted!
customer_reviews.author: Kacy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wont turn on
customer_reviews.text: Only used twice. Now it wont turn on. Tech basically says buy a new one - not worth service. Love it when it worked but VERY disappointed now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this label maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this label maker!!! So easy to use and tons of extra features - fonts, frames, symbols. I've had a smaller, handheld one, and this one is well worth the extra money. It is a little pricey at it's full price, but does go on sale, which is what I waited for. The difference is huge between what my old one and this one does - for only about $30 difference in price! Very easy to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: AliseMat

customer_reviews.title: Yes! It has multiple sizes! Up to 1”!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many label makers. But this one.......IT. IS. MY. FAVORITE. It has a variety of sizes of labels and like 20 different colors of tape. The kids 5 and 8 yo also use it on their own. I’m so impressed with this machine I even bought a case for it today.
customer_reviews.author: BDS2009

customer_reviews.title: Bigger is Better
customer_reviews.text: Bigger is better when it comes to ummmm?.. aging eyes. I'm grateful for the larger font sizes and the ability to color coordinate for quicker discovery at a glance.
customer_reviews.author: Steve... still in the frontier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for that teacher...
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a teacher and I got this for her for Christmas 2019. PERFECT! I also purchased a multi pack of label cartridges for it so she has many options when it comes to being organized! Another plus is it has dual power option (ac or battery power!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brawl Dog

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. I had been using handwritten labels on gaffers ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I had been using handwritten labels on gaffers tape. Total retro mixtape vibe...but my handwriting is a bit crap and readability was not great. This thing is wonderful for labelling cables and all sorts of stuff. The software is...eh...it is ok. Good for its intended market. At some point I'm going to have to figure out how to automate some of it though.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Shultz

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is starting kindergarten so I decided I needed a new school supply too. Wanted something to label her items that could do more than just general text. This machine is fantastic! Easy to use (I never read the instructions) with lots of great graphics.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Very impressive!
customer_reviews.text: This one has software to easily install on your computer, making label designs and printing a breeze. I'm looking around the house for more things to label because it's so fun to do. Also, does not waste labels with long leads and tails. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Yoyo C

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, PC Compatibility is Bad
customer_reviews.text: It works, but a little difficult to use. Be careful of what size tape you buy, and what color. The P-Touch Editor is absolute crap, so don't even think about using the PC feature. That's the main reason I purchased it, so I'm disappointed. You'll get the same thing from a labeler a quarter of the price.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: The more you know
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be amazing and change my life. I used it once about 4 months ago and haven't gotten it out of the drawer again. It's just a fancy label maker that doesn't make your labels look any fancier. I just bought a new printer and will use that to make (or not make) all my labels. Don't waste your money on this. If you really want one...contact me, I have a used one at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Money Well Spent
customer_reviews.text: "Do you know where your mother's label maker is?" "No, why?' "That candle she put in my office? Now it says, 'Light in case of dad farts' on the side. It is so on." Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Jams and issues right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Upon receiving, it would only successfully print one in three times. 2 out of 3 times it would wad up and jam instead of coming out. I don't have time to mess around with it and will be returning it for a cheaper, simpler unit.
customer_reviews.author: Thelionator

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Label Maker
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to load. Does not do micro print which I use occasionally. I like this label maker for the keyboard and quality of label it makes. Costs a little more, but minimizes label frustration. Have not used tech support so cannot rate.
customer_reviews.author: DocDon

customer_reviews.title: I think it's a good label printer at this price
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a good label printer at this price. However, it is slightly difficult to modify and use the type of label provided. It is likely to require easier use.
customer_reviews.author: Suh

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to organize the garage. I like that it accepts multiple thickness tape. Very easy to use. I used recommendation of another amazon customer to adjust spaces before and after print to save tape. Definitely recommend product - love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, I love it
customer_reviews.text: This device is bigger than it looks. It's nicely built, it turns on fast and it has every setting I want right on the machine. I thought I was going to have to use the PC to get labels just right but now I see that that was not the case. The graphical LCD is a great feature because you can see the actual label layout before you print it.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Labeler does what it is designed to do
customer_reviews.text: I like the labeler but its screen is sometimes hard for me to read. This makes it more difficult for me to use. The printing itself is top notch and very clear. It also has an assortment of fonts built-in that make the device quite useful.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoGene47

customer_reviews.title: A great label maker
customer_reviews.text: I like all the size and color options. Most of all, I like the ability to print with small 2mm margins. The labels are superb. I wish the label maker had arial narrow font (you can use any font when printing from a PC) I wish it had better PC software, perhaps a modern Windows universal store app. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Label Maker
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product works very well. It's easy to use after you sit down and figure out all the settings. There are different sizes to the label maker and you have to figure out how to switch from each setting. This is not a easy one push button label printer. However it does print well once you put all the settings in place and what size labels you would like to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I'm lazy about reviews and I should have written this long ago. This is a fantastic machine.I love that it is so versatile with different tapes and characters. The main reason I chose this model is that it has a USB connection. Not that I'm lazy (oops, I already let on that I am) but it's nice being able to enter the information via computer.
customer_reviews.author: DAM1

customer_reviews.title: I can do all kinds of labels and they look great
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is just what I needed for years. Its made tough and I am making all kinds of labels. So easy to use. Wow.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Prints nicely. I've used their 1/2" and 1" tape
customer_reviews.text: I use this ALL THE TIME. Prints nicely. I've used their 1/2" and 1" tape, silver or white with black letters. Can even print pictures. (Use snip tool or something, and add to the PTouch software - really easy.)
customer_reviews.author: Dyl

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I love using this labeller. The PC connection adds ease on use despite the fact that the existing templates leaves much to be desired!
customer_reviews.author: Edgar H. Tan, MD

customer_reviews.title: Nice labels, crappy app
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, it wastes a lot of label paper. It cuts off 1/2” each and every time. And there is no way to stop it. Also the computer app is horrible. You have to open and close the app every time or the label will not print correctly. It can remember that it is on auto length between words as you can see in my photos. Also you can see how it automatically cuts off the 1/2” in the printing window on the pc.
customer_reviews.author: Malekia

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never used a label maker before but always wanted to. I’m addicted, I want to label everything! This little machine is amazing! It’s so easy to use. Another reviewer posted how to make the margins smaller which really helped me to not waste the tape. The tape that it comes with is a nice size. I would also order a case to hold the label maker, cord and extra tapes. I love it! You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Prints flawlessly, but wastes tape unnecessarily.
customer_reviews.text: Great label printer that works perfectly with my Mac, and uses generic tape without issue. My only complaint is that every time you print a label, it insists on wasting about 3/4" of tape - and there seems to be nothing you can do about it. That, my friends, is just dumb.
customer_reviews.author: OnTheMarkTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This label maker far exceeded my expectations! It's very easy to use as a standalone unit. I also connected with my PC and it was simple to install the editor software. The PC setup allowed me to work on my project anywhere and then print the labels at a later time. I would highly recommend this product without hesitation!!
customer_reviews.author: Miata Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on TikTok and I needed a new label maker. It works great. There are a lot of different setting which is really nice. Just takes some getting used to as there are a lot of settings.
customer_reviews.author: Slave2tattoos

customer_reviews.title: lots of options you can customize for your labels to appear nice. The label is strong easy to paste from ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality of machine is well built, lots of options you can customize for your labels to appear nice. The label is strong easy to paste from your desired labeling. The problem is the way the machine is design to cut at least half inch every time you are printing a label, creating a waste that can be reused instead of cutting, then you have to buy more labels faster and sooner when you label a lot. That is your choice to make.
customer_reviews.author: Vinceley

customer_reviews.title: Best Brother P-Touch so far
customer_reviews.text: Product has more versatility than previous models. It has more formatting, character sets, and printing options. Would recommend to new Brother customers, or those looking to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: MKilar

customer_reviews.title: A handy device.
customer_reviews.text: The label printer works on battery or AC power. The LCD display is easy to read and shows exactly what is printed. You can print two rows at a time, in different fonts and vertically if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This is junk, stop working on me, not even a day with it breaks down. Dymo is the top of all lable makers. I should never had bought this. It waste tape when printing out something.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bird

customer_reviews.title: no more tape
customer_reviews.text: this is a very good quality label maker. I dont need to waste my time with tape anymore. this is just what i needed
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Good but poor software.
customer_reviews.text: Found the user experience very clunky. They need to revise software to make it easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bookworth

customer_reviews.title: You'll become addicted
customer_reviews.text: I started making labels, the moment this arrived. I already have two smaller P-touch labelers, but they don't make the 3/4" labels. I spend hours, making labels for EVERYTHING.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fulfills all my hopes and dreams
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This machine is lovely. It truly satisfies all my wildest fantasies regarding office supplies. I have consummated this new relationship by labeling almost everything in my house. You're welcome, fam.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: TZ V TZe?
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. But, my old printer, that this is replacing, could take both TZ and YZe tapes, and this won't, leaving me stuck with a lot of supplies that should have been usable.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Cisin

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Great label maker. Love that it makes THICK labels for 2-3 lines! Can’t find that in other label makers
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey Moshier

customer_reviews.title: Still using
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, besides the inch of wasted paper for each print.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the best. Have been enjoying making labels for my note binders, file folders and also pantry items. My next project will be to label all my cd cases.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: This is a great Labeler.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Labeler. I use the easy to use Computer program and I can easily setup different labels and colors to save and use as needed. Easy to change Ribbons.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nauman

product_meta.title: Brother P-touch Label Maker, PC-Connectable Labeler, PTD600, Color Display, High-Resolution PC Printing, Black, Black/gray
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard Packaging

The Brother P touch PTD600 PC Connectable Label Maker is well suited for multiple labeling uses in business or personal environments. A built in keyboard and the ability to quick connect to PCs or Macs allow users to create more personalized labels. An intuitive, full color graphical display offers easy access for users to review the actual label’s appearance prior to printing. This feature allows you to edit on the fly to ensure that your label is printed correctly the first time.

There are a lot of personalized label functions that let you create labels of exceptional quality. You can choose from 14 fonts, 11 styles, 99 frames, and over 600 symbols plus barcodes to design professional labels. The label printer then takes your design and produces high resolution labels that highlight your logos, graphics, and more. The PT D600 also prints labels exceptionally fast and has an automatic tape cutter for high volume printing jobs.

This PC connectable label printer also contains a large memory that allows you to save up to 99 commonly used labels. This feature helps you save time with common reprinting jobs. With the included AC power adapter and USB cable, you’ll be confident that your label maker will be ready when you are. The PT D600 works with 5 different TZe tape widths. The convenient, top loading tape design lets you easily swap out tape cassette colors and sizes. These labels are laminated and durable, helping them withstand heat, water, and fading. For use with Brother Genuine P touch TZe tapes: TZe MQF31, TZe MQE31, TZe MQ531, TZe2312PK, TZe1312PK, TZe 111, TZe 211, TZe N201, TZe 315, TZe S211, TZe 121, TZe 325, TZe 221, TZe 421, TZe S121, TZe S221, TZe S621, TZe 131, TZe 135, TZe 231, TZe 232, TZe 334, TZe 335, TZe 631, TZe AF131, TZe AF231, TZe FA3, TZe FX231, TZe FX631, TZe MQ835, TZe MQ934, TZe MQG35, TZe MQP35, TZe S131, TZe S135, TZe S231, TZe S631, TZe 141, TZe 145, TZe 241, TZe 242, TZe 243, TZe 344, TZe 345, TZe 441, TZe 541, TZe 545, TZe 641, TZe 741, TZe B41, TZe FX241, TZe S141, TZe S241, TZe S641, TZe S941.TZe CL4, TZe S241, TZe SE4, TZe 151, TZe 251, TZe 252, TZe 354, TZe 355, TZe 451, TZe 651, TZe B51, TZe FX251, TZe FX651, TZe S151, TZe S251, TZe S651, TZe S951.
feature_bullets: Smart compact design with large keyboard and convenient top loading tape design
Full color, high resolution display with backlight
Create labels using the wide easy type keyboard or connect to a PC or MAC for additional functionality
Includes ac adapter or purchase batteries for on the go use
2 year limited warranty and free phone support for the life of your product
